author: ixamnis
body:
I have multiple brokerage accounts and I do have on for just investing in ETFs.  Keeping it simple is a pretty solid approach.  However, I'm not thrilled with your choices.  **VOO** and **QQQ** will have a lot of overlap, so you aren't diversifying as much as you might think. **QQQ** is a great ETF, but the underlying index it uses as a benchmark contains 100 stocks.  (The NASDAQ 100).  **VOO** uses the S&P 500, so it obviously contains 500 stocks. Many of the top holdings are going to be the same in both of those ETFs: Apple, Microsoft, Google, Facebook, Netflix, Amazon. There are, of course, differences, as well.

I also don't like your choice of **VYM** because of its poor return. It has a 10 year return on investment of just 115%, while VOO is double that and **QQQ** has a return of more than 4 times that of **VYM**. **VYM** will also hold many of the companies you are already investing in with **VOO**.

**QQQ** has one of the highest returns of any ETF, but it is Tech-heavy, so there may be a bit more risk than **VOO**.  

You don't tell us your age, your financial goals and how averse you are to risk, but assuming you are reasonably young (more than 20 years away from retirement) and don't mind some risk, I might suggest a strategy more along the lines of:

**QQQ**: 25%

**VOO**: 25%   (with the understanding that there is some overlap. The blue chip stocks in VOO will help your portfolio to be a little less volatile than putting 50% into QQQ.)

**SOXX:**  10% - iShares PHLX Semiconductor ETF - this is a sector ETF that invests in companies that produce semi-conductors (and related companies). The top holdings of this ETF include Broadcom, Intel, NVIDIA, Texas Instruments, Qualcomm, Micron Technology, Taiwan Semiconductor, Analog Devices and NXP Semiconductors.  The might be a little overlap with this one and QQQ, but there shouldn't be much.

**ICLN:**  20% - ICLN is an ETF that invests in green/renewable energy. It is a passively managed index fund that uses the S&P Global Clean Energy Index as its benchmark. Many of its holdings are outside the US.  (If you prefer a more US focused ETF that invests in renewable energy, consider QCLN instead, but be aware that its top holding is NIO, an electric vehicle maker based in China). 

**ARKK:**  10% - The ARK funds are actively managed and they invest in "disruptive," innovative companies, many of which are in the tech sector.  Tesla is the top holding of this fund.

**VXUS**: 10% - This is an investment that tracks the performance of a benchmark index that measures the investment return of stocks issued by companies located in developed and emerging markets, excluding the US. The fund tracks the FTSE all Cap ex US Index fund. Top holdings include Alibaba, Tencent Holdings, Taiwan Semiconductor (a little overlap with SOXX) Nestle, Roche Holding, SAP SE, Novartis, Toyota and ASML.  While the long term track record of this fund isn't great, the recent addition of Alibaba, Tencent and other companies signal a likely more profitable future.

I think an approach like this will give you the additional diversity you are looking for and a more aggressive return than the choices you've made in your post. 

*I'm not a professional Financial advisor and I didn't sleep in a Holiday Inn Express last night. I do own shares in many of the funds I've listed above.*

author: Rapidavenger941
body: Learn what you're doing before you get fucked. Be sure it's a cash account. If its cash you wont have funds settle until at least the next trading day. If you have under 25k in account they can freeze your account for 30-90 days (forget how long) if you're marked as a Pattern Day Trader. PDT rule stops you from making multiple day trades in a 5-7 trading days. I believe you get 3 before you're locked out. That's bought and sold on the same day. Doesnt matter if it's all the same day. Each txn will count as a day trade.

author: RR-dapz
body:
Got out of my calls held over the weekend for a minimal loss. Just glad to be out.

Moved to a portfolio of shares of (~5k each)
IRM, NAVI, BLK, ABBV, PFE, TGT, MMM, RTX, TXN, IBM, MSFT, TSLA

Going to sell some covered calls and chill for a bit until volatility chills and we go full Pump.

Option trading has done well, but think its time to see what the trend is before hopping back in.

I'm leaving a small ~2k option fund to play around with because you know its hard to resist.

author: Killerslug
body: What happened with TXN AH? also, is that the cause for the SOXL moon?

author: JeffB1517
body:
Of course they will languish when they are offering large dividends they won't be aggressive growth companies just growth.  Successful companies go through a rapid growth phase, then a slow growth phase, then a slowly shrinking phase.  https://www.reddit.com/r/IncomeInvesting/comments/eu67r0/the_200_year_bond/

That has to happen to the tech sector as the technologies mature.  The rapidly growing tech companies from decades ago: HP, IBM, Unisys, Eastman Kodak, IT&T, AT&T, Intel, Polaroid, Xerox, Texas Instruments.... are not today's exciting growth stocks.

author: 95Daphne
body:
I like AVGO a lot but it's already ran pretty hot.

Personally, one of the stocks I've started to watch to possibly add is TXN, I would've never figured that they do the things that they do, I thought it was mainly a calculators company lol. They're also a semiconductor sector stock.

author: dwdsquared2
body:
**Events in the US Today (EDT):**

* DAY - Wear a mask & socially distance <3
* 8:30am - Building Permits (Sep) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * Housing Starts (Sep) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 9:00am - FOMC Member WIlliams Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 10:50am - FOMC Member Quarles Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 12:30pm - Nancy Pelosi appears live on Bloomberg Radio & TV
* 1:00pm - 2-Year Note Auction \[1/3 Volatility\]
   * Chicago Fed Pres. Evans Speaks \[1/3 Volatility\]
* 4:30pm - API Weekly Crude Oil Stock \[2/3 Volatility\]
* Thursday is the final presidential debate.
* White House and congressional negotiators are barreling toward a deadline later today to strike a deal on a coronavirus relief package, with the Trump administration and Democrats attempting to bridge differences after months of talks.
   * Pelosi and Mnuchin are expected to talk again on Tuesday, with the Treasury secretary in the Middle East to lead the U.S.-Israeli delegation to the United Arab Emirates and Bahrain. 
* Intel has agreed to a $9 billion deal to sell most of its memory business to South Korea’s SK Hynix.
* Moderna Chief Executive Officer Stéphane Bancel expects interim results from its Covid-19 vaccine trial in November and said the U.S government could give an emergency use nod in December.

**Events in the World Today (EDT):**

* 3:00am - Germany PPI (MoM-Sep) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 5:30am - UK MPC Member Vlieghe Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 11:00am - New Zealand GlobalDairyTrade Price Index \[2/3 Volatility\]
* The pound wavered versus the euro after the U.K. held out for additional European Union concessions as a condition for resuming trade talks.
* Earlier in the Asia day, the Australian dollar slid after comments from the central bank’s assistant governor that short-term rates could fall below zero.
* Brexit trade talks are likely to continue at least into next week if the U.K. and EU fail to reach an agreement.
* Ireland placed all non-essential businesses in lockdown for six weeks, in what is the most dramatic measure yet by a European government to bring the second wave of the Covid-19 pandemic under control.

**Earnings Before Open:**

* P&G, Lockheed Martin, Synchrony Financial, Travelers

**Earnings After Close:**

* Netflix, Snap, Texas Instruments, iRobot, Teradyne, Calix, WD-40, Navient, Interactive Brokers, Loop Industries

[Earnings This Week](https://i.imgur.com/ffP3FJL.png)

author: trollerinn
body:
honestly.. I've got leveraged puts on oil going down to at least 33.5.. hopefully 32 if gods be blessed.. if stars align .. fkn.. 25 a barrel as everything is messed up cuz of covid in so many parts of europe. Can make a load but you gotta have a huge stoploss and watch it go through the red
If biden wins, might even be more and longer lockdowns.. still seem to be making to much.. 

also - just a random which has been stable -.. a bit of a bet.. but I could see TXN going up to 160 before christmas.

Vista could go down as guns have been dipping and they sell a lot of ammo - havent done any research but thats the autism way.. VSTO could fall as well if they follow suit with american outdoors (smithwesson)

Don't listen to anything I say though
